text: OF TACITUS. 49 times, when, at their ease, they traversed book the lakes of Campania, and went on sail- ing parties to the cities of Achaia; but now the scene was changed to the Alps, the Pyreneans, and long tracts of country, where they were to march under a load of armour scarce supportable. XXIV. While the minds of the sol- diers were, by these means, thrown into vio- lent agitations, Maevius Pudens, a near re- lation of Tigellinus, added fuel to the flame. Whoever was known to be of a light and versatile disposition, in distress for money, or fond of public commotions, this man attracted to his party. He sapped his way with a degree of dexterity, as un- perceived as it was successful. As often as Galba was entertained at Otho's house, he distributed to the cohort on duty a hundred sesterces for every man, under colour of an allowance for their usual con- vivial party.
